common_issues.title: PiecesOS Boot-up and Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported PiecesOS getting stuck during boot-up at "ensure core dependency" or failing to launch after update 11.1.1. This affected both macOS and Windows users.  The issue seems to be related to stricter hardware requirements and core dependencies. Updating to the latest PiecesOS version (11.1.2) and desktop app (3.3.8) resolved the issue for most users.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## GitHub Issue Summary: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up (cannot run): Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application

**Key Points:**

* **Issue:** PiecesOS takes a long time to boot up and gets stuck at the "ensure core dependency" step.
* **Platforms:** Windows, macOS
* **Potential causes:**
    * **Windows:**
        * Outdated or corrupted installation
        * Outdated or incompatible hardware
        * Conflict with other software
    * **macOS:**
        * Unknown
* **Solutions:**
    * **Windows:**
        * Update PiecesOS to the latest version (11.1.2 as of 2025-02-17)
        * Reinstall PiecesOS
        * Check for hardware compatibility
        * Ensure other software is not interfering
    * **macOS:**
        * Update PiecesOS to the latest version (11.1.2 as of 2025-02-17)
        * Close and reopen the PiecesOS app
        * Update the PiecesOS desktop app to version 3.3.8 (released in 2025-02-17)
* **Current Status:**
    * **Windows:** Resolved for most users
    * **macOS:** Resolved for some users, but still experiencing issues
* **Next Steps:**
    * **Windows:** Monitor for further reports
    * **macOS:** Investigate further to identify the cause of the issue and implement a fix

**Additional Notes:**

* Several users reported that updating to the latest version of PiecesOS (11.1.1) did not resolve the issue.
* Some users reported that reinstalling PiecesOS did not resolve the issue.
* One user reported that conflicting software (OneDrive) was causing the issue.
* One user reported that PiecesOS was running fine in the background despite being stuck at the "ensure core dependency" step.
* The PiecesOS team is actively working on resolving the issue.

**Timeline:**

* **2025-02-05:** Issue reported
* **2025-02-06:** PiecesOS team acknowledged the issue and provided troubleshooting steps
* **2025-02-07:** Update to PiecesOS 11.1.1 released
* **2025-02-11:** Additional troubleshooting steps provided for Windows users
* **2025-02-14:** Update to PiecesOS 11.1.2 released
* **2025-02-17:** Update to PiecesOS desktop app 3.3.8 released, addressing the issue for macOS users

**Conclusion:**

The issue of PiecesOS getting stuck at the "ensure core dependency" step has been resolved for most users. However, some macOS users are still experiencing the issue. The PiecesOS team is actively working on identifying the cause of the issue and implementing a fix.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch.
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7a6a7957-5aa1-4d53-b492-cf4470aa5edc)
## GitHub Issue Summary: PiecesOS launch issues

**Problem:** Several users, including DevWizard24 and GetReal444, reported that PiecesOS wouldn't launch after update 11.1.1.

**Key points:**

* The issue was related to stricter hardware requirements in the update.
* The support team requested logs from users experiencing the issue.
* A fix was planned for release within 24-48 hours.
* A patch release (11.1.2) was deployed to address the issue.

**Solutions:**

* Users were asked to provide logs to help diagnose the issue.
* A patch release (11.1.2) was deployed to fix the problem.

**Current status:**

* The issue has been resolved with the release of PiecesOS 11.1.2.
* The issue is closed.

**Outcome:**

* Users experiencing the launch issue should update to PiecesOS 11.1.2 to resolve the problem.
* The support team was responsive and provided timely updates and solutions.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS launch crashes due to hardware incompatibility
common_issues.description: Users reported PiecesOS crashing on launch after updating to version 11.1.1. The issue stemmed from a new dependency requiring AVX2 support, missing in older CPUs. This affected macOS and Windows users. The Pieces team resolved the issue in version 11.1.2 by patching the dependency to support a wider range of CPUs.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After upgrade PiecesOS to version 11.1..1 it crashes every time immediately after launch. Previous version worked well. Attached is the crash report log.

Environment: 

- OS MacOS 15.2
- CPU Intel 

[trace.log](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18777512/trace.log)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* GonzoSosa reported an issue where PiecesOS was unable to launch on macOS with the Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-3210M CPU.
* The issue was related to the new vector library requiring AVX2 support, which is not available on older CPUs like the i5-3210M.

**Problems Identified:**

* The new vector library was causing issues on older CPUs without AVX2 support.
* Users were experiencing crashes and inability to launch PiecesOS.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces team released a new version 11.1.2 with a fix for the AVX2 issue.
* The fix involved updating the vector library to support a wider range of CPUs.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue has been resolved with the release of version 11.1.2.
* GonzoSosa confirmed that the fix works for their system.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue was likely affecting users with older CPUs released before 2016/2017.
* The Pieces team was responsive and provided a timely solution.

related_issues.title: Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
related_issues.text:
Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

For the past week, anytime that I launch pieces I see this: 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/61f18fb6-8846-46d8-8747-5c415fd2e82d)

Pieces OS just doesn't open, no matter what.

I tried to reinstall everything, but also no progress.

How to fix it? (Also to mention, Pieces desktop app is in Early Access program, but I don't know if this information is useful)
## Issue Summary: PiecesOS Boot Error 

**Key points:**

* The user @GetReal444 reported booting problems with PiecesOS. 
* The issue seems to be related to a hardware requirement of the "CouchbaseLite" database extension, which requires “AVX2” support not available on user's machine.

**Problems identified:**

* Due to missing "AVX2" support, the "CouchbaseLite" database extension failed to load, causing booting problems.
* This issue impacted multiple users.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* The Pieces team acknowledged the issue and proposed updating to the latest version (11.1.2) of PiecesOS, as it contains a patch to address the hardware dependency.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The user confirmed the issue was resolved after upgrading to the 11.1.2 version of PiecesOS. 

**Additional notes:**

* The team is actively working on a permanent fix for this problem, potentially by using an alternative database extension or solution.
* Similar issues were logged in Issues #624 and #625.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Boot Failure
common_issues.description: Users reported PiecesOS failing to boot up on Ubuntu, Windows, and macOS due to a "DatabaseException" related to the "CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch" extension. The issue stemmed from hardware incompatibility with the extension's AVX2 requirement. Upgrading to PiecesOS version 11.1.2, which includes a patch addressing the hardware dependency, resolved the issue for most users.

related_issues.title: Facing error on Ubuntu while opening Pieces "DatabaseException"
related_issues.text:
Facing error on Ubuntu while opening Pieces "DatabaseException"
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Faccing "DatabaseException(Unable to load 'CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch' extenstion" (1), code : can'tOpenFile)" on my ubuntu desktop 
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* User (@Rohit0072) reported an issue with booting up the Pieces application.
* Pieces support team triaged the issue and identified related issues.
* @Rohit0072 received support from @mark-at-pieces and @tsavo-at-pieces.
* A potential fix was released in PiecesOS version 11.1.2.

**Problems Identified:**

* Application not booting up.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* User suggested related issues for reference.
* Support team offered assistance via calendar link and email.
* Potential fix implemented in PiecesOS 11.1.2 release.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue resolved with PiecesOS v11.1.2 update.
* Issue closed by @mark-at-pieces. To be reopened if unresolved.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS connectivity and local LLM issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces for Developers failing to connect to cloud services and utilize local LLMs. This might be due to firewall restrictions, network issues, or problems with specific PiecesOS versions. Solutions include checking network connectivity, firewall settings, updating PiecesOS, and providing logs to support for further assistance.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Issue:** Rohanrathi99 is experiencing problems making requests to Pieces cloud services and with local models.

**Key Points:**

* The issue was automatically triaged by the Pieces-support-bot.
* The user may encounter similar issues related to Copilot bugs, model downloads, and core dependencies.
* Helpful resources like existing issues, documentation, and YouTube channel were suggested.
* Mark-at-pieces, a member of the Pieces team, responded and requested logs for further troubleshooting.

**Problems Identified:**

* Firewall or network configuration might be blocking outgoing requests from PiecesOS.
* Local model issues are also present.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Check the suggested related issues.
* Review documentation and YouTube channel.
* Provide com.pieces.os and com.pieces.pfd logs to mark-at-pieces.
* Schedule a real-time debugging session through the provided calendar link.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User has been contacted by Pieces support and offered solutions. 
* The issue requires further investigation with provided logs or a debugging session.

related_issues.title: Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
related_issues.text:
Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
Error: HttpException: Connection closed before full header was received, uri = http://127.0.0.1:39300/model/2fca5f65-b3ce-459b-b394-0ea5de0b050d/download/progress

**Installation Details**

Succeeded: true
Path: C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\com.MeshIntelligentTechnologi.PiecesOS_11.0.4.0_x64__84gz00a5z79wr/os_server.exe

**PiecesOS Information**

ID: 62ded9e8-d9d0-490e-b34e-632516b3cf1a

User: Anonymous
Current Version: 11.0.4
Min Version Supported: 11.0.4
Max Version Supported: 12.0.0
Local Port: 39300

**Device Information**

Operating System: Windows
Current Version: "Windows 10 Home Single Language" 10.0 (Build 26100)
Min Version Supported: Windows 10 Build 1903
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* @AmanSingh766 is encountering an exception when trying to download local LLMs.
* The error message is: "Connection closed before full header was received, uri = http://127.0.0.1:39300/model/2fca5f65-b3ce-459b-b394-0ea5de0b050d/download/progress"

**Problems Identified:**

* The user is unable to download local LLMs.
* The cause of the error is unclear.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @mark-at-pieces suggests providing support logs and checking if the issue persists with all LLMs.
* A potential fix may have been implemented in version 11.1.2.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* It is unclear whether the issue has been resolved. @AmanSingh766 has not provided any feedback since February 17th, 2025.
* @mark-at-pieces requests the user to reopen the issue if the problem persists.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Launch Issues After Update
common_issues.description: Users reported PiecesOS failing to launch after updating to version 11.1.0 or 11.1.1. The issue was attributed to accidental installation of the Intel version on ARM Macs and stricter hardware requirements. Solutions included reinstalling the correct version from the official website and a patch release (11.1.2) to address hardware compatibility.

related_issues.title: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0
related_issues.text: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0 If you cannot open PiecesOS after updating to 11.1.0 and you are on an arm Machine M1, M2, M3,...etc then it is likely that you accidentally installed the intel version of the application. If you are Unsure. Please uninstall Pieces OS from your applications folder and reinstall from https://docs.pieces.app/installation-getting-started/macos (Arm == Apple Silicon) You can tell if you are working with Arm architecture if you see something that resembles this within your 'About this Mac' If you are still having issues after trying these steps please feel free to add a comment on this issue and schedule a time on my calendar here. https://calendar.app.google/MGd9i5gELtiDjWZm8 ## GitHub Issue Summary **Title:** (Title of the issue) **Status:** Closed (Resolved) **Key Points:** * The issue was reported on 2025-02-17 by mark-at-pieces. * The author marked the issue as resolved without providing further explanation. **Outcome:** * The issue has been closed, but the exact nature of the problem and solution remain unclear. * Additional information is needed to fully understand the context and resolution. **Next Steps:** * If further details are required, consider reopening the issue and requesting additional information from the author or other contributors.

### Checked for Existing Issues?

## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary
**Issue:** PiecesOS takes a long time to boot-up (unable to run)

**Key Points:**

* User reported slow boot-up times and inability to run PiecesOS.
* Pieces-support-bot suggested relevant issues and resources.
* Mark-at-pieces acknowledged the issue and informed the user about an upcoming release.

**Problems Identified:**

* Slow boot-up times and inability to run piecesOS.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Release of PiecesOS 11.1.2.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue closed, assuming the problem was resolved with the new release. If the issue persists, the user can reopen the ticket.

recommendations: **Prioritize hardware compatibility testing:** The influx of issues related to CPU incompatibility highlights the need for rigorous hardware compatibility testing before major releases.

**Improve communication about hardware requirements:** Clearly communicate any changes to system requirements in release notes and on the PiecesOS download page to prevent users from installing incompatible versions.
**Develop a robust solution for older hardware:** Explore alternative dependencies or solutions to ensure PiecesOS remains accessible to users with older CPUs.

**Enhance error messaging:** Provide more informative error messages that clearly indicate the source of the problem (e.g., specific hardware incompatibility) to help users troubleshoot issues more effectively.

**Create a dedicated troubleshooting guide for connectivity issues:** Develop a comprehensive guide for resolving cloud service and local LLM connectivity problems, covering common causes like firewall settings and network configuration.
**Investigate Pieces for Developers connectivity issues:** The reported problems with Pieces for Developers require further investigation to identify the root cause and implement a permanent fix.

**Monitor user feedback for new PiecesOS versions:** Closely monitor user feedback following the release of PiecesOS 11.1.2 to ensure the patch effectively addresses the reported issues and identify any new problems that may arise.
